comments.text: Punto perfetto per andare verso il nord/confine Cinese. I camionisti cinesi  sono degli ottimi compagni di viaggio: ho fatto autostop 10 minuti e per due giorni ho viaggiato su tre diversi camion.

Best spot to get north from LPB
Cars need to slow down because of the roundabout and bad road conditions. Many trucks would go all the way to China
Best spot.

Best hitching spot for going north. Stand on the beginning of the highway (somewhere around the big ass gate). Plenty of space for cars to pull up. You can get there by taking local bus number 19 or a songthaew from Talat Sao
I had no problem hitching from here towards Luang Namtha. There is much road work going on along this route. You may well get a ride with some workers. Remember, do not sleep outside. It is illegal!
At first i thought its not a good spot because all of the busses leaving. But a nice couple picked me up after short time. Good spot afterall.
Perfect spot to get so Xeno.

A lot of trucks going all the way to Vietnam, if you’re lucky you’ll find a two-days ride to Hanoi (maybe a bit longer). If not still a great spot, there’s a grocery and a tires repairer so lots of people will stop
Perfect spot, due to road conditions every car has to slow down. It’s a bit out of Luang Prabang so if you’re going north almost everybody will be going in your direction
Amazing spot, all cars need to completely slow down due to a piece of dirt road and they have space to pull over. Also you have good shade until the afternoon

If you're planning to go to Vang Vieng, hitchhiking on the highway might be your best bet. While there may be fewer drivers than on the other route, you could get lucky and catch a direct ride to Vang Vieng. I only waited two minutes before getting picked up. The signs in Lao are really helpful.
Quickly got a ride from truck driver. Spot just behind the gas station
Quickly got a ride from truck driver to Phou Khoun. Spot just behind the gas station.
Only on car stop for me and then directly to my hostel.
there weren't many cars during the weekday but it is a nice spot on the main road more outside of the city where you can still walk to from the centre
Good spot, was quite late to try to get to vientiane but worked out in zhe end :)

All of this main road is a good spot, plenty of cars and space to stop. Only issue is that people is going in many different directions, they will just take you out of town, you must be lucky to find somebody that takes you to your destination
More cars and trucks than on the free route. Got a ride straight to Vientiane
Not many cars but there are truck drivers goin to Luang Prabang
just past town. Low traffic, but wait-time reasonable
Only one car stopped and directly to Vientiane
My second day HH in Laos I was just lucky! I got a ride for 10 hours and make 380 km ! Until Nong Khiaw
Might have been lucky but quickly got a ride directly to Phonsavan (~7 hours). If you need more shelter from the sun I'd suggest going further uphill.
Towards Luangprabang. Loads of cars and plenty of space to stop, but locals just don't undestand the concept. Tried for 1-2h and took a bus (2011).

I actually didn’t manage to find a ride but it was very late afternoon. Still there are many cars passing but there are two directions they can go. There’s a grocery store with a toilet but there’s no accommodation in town

Once you cross the border from Vietnam to Laos, you probably will get stuck for a few hours! No traffic at all ! So, take water with you and some snacks! And wave your hands! I was waiting 5 hours for the first ride like 80km

You can catch a truck to Vang Vieng but don't do it in rainy season. The roads are often blocked by landslides. It took us 2 days instead if 4 hours. Try to catch on the other road to Kasi, cars choose this road as there are no trucks.
Not the greates spot. Got a quick ride outsode the city

there is no traffic towards vietnam
I saw only one truck in 2 hours.
Better to try on the paid route.
